Class AbstractLoader<T>

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.io.AbstractLoader<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of object to load.
Direct Known Subclasses:
NasaExoplanets, SimbadLoader
public abstract class AbstractLoader<T> extends Object

This class represents a generic loader with built-in caching and local backup capabilities.

Version:
5.0, December 21, 2014
Author:
Jean-Marie Dautelle, Silvere Martin-Michiellot

    • AbstractLoader

      public AbstractLoader()

  • Method Details

    • setCacheEnabled

      public void setCacheEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Configures the loader to use or bypass the cache.
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable caching, false otherwise

    • setBackupPath

      public void setBackupPath(String path)
      Sets the local backup path (resource path) for fallback.
      Parameters:
      path - resource path (e.g. "/backup/")

    • load

      public T load(String id) throws Exception
      Loads the object identified by the specified ID. This method checks the cache first (if enabled), then attempts to load from source. If loading fails, it attempts to load from a local backup.
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier of the object to load.
      Returns:
      the loaded object.
      Throws:
      Exception - if loading fails.

    • loadFromSource

      protected abstract T loadFromSource(String id) throws Exception
      Loads the object from the primary source (e.g., remote URL, database).
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier.
      Returns:
      the loaded object.
      Throws:
      Exception - if loading fails.

    • loadFromBackup

      protected T loadFromBackup(String id)
      Loads the object from a local backup (e.g., resource file). Default implementation attempts to load from the classpath using the backup path.
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier.
      Returns:
      the loaded object, or null if not found.

    • clearCache

      public void clearCache()
      Clears the cache.
